bibl.title: Letter from Hideyo Noguchi to Henry Rose Carter, June 22, 1922

div1.p: Noguchi writes to Carter concerning the confusion over human experimentation in the 1921 Rockefeller Foundation report.

div1.head: Letter from Hideyo Noguchi to Henry Rose Carter, June 22, 1922
div1.opener:
I H. B
Noguchi
THE ROCKEFELLER INSTITUTE
FOR MEDICAL RESEARCH
66TH STREET AND AVENUE A
NEW YORK
June 22, 1922
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
President Vincent has referred to me
your letter to him of June 14th. I am enclosing a
copy of my reply to President Vincent as well as my
letter to Dr. White and will let you know promptly what
I hear from the latter.

If I had known that there was any ques-
tion in your mind regarding these data, I would have
verified them in writing before quoting them as I have
done, but I had such implicit confidence in the statement
of Dr. White, who had just returned from the scene of
action, that it never occurred to me that there was any
doubt about it. I feel sure Dr. White will be able to
clear up the whole matter.

It is not clear in my mind whether you
were present during the last epidemic while Dr. Hanson
was in charge. Dr. White was there from July 15 to August
21, 1921.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Hideyo Noguchi Dr. H. R. Carter
2121 California St. NW
Washington, D.C.
